ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl

Class AbstractGlslProgramAttribute<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl.AbstractGlslProgramInput<T>
      • ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl.AbstractGlslProgramStorageBuffer<T>
        • ray.rage.rendersystem.shader.glsl.AbstractGlslProgramAttribute<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of attribute that can be passed to a GLSL shader program.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<GpuShaderProgram>, Nameable, GpuShaderProgram.Attribute<T>, GpuShaderProgram.Input<T>, GpuShaderProgram.LocatableInput<T>, GpuShaderProgram.StorageBuffer<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGlslProgramAttributeBuffer

    abstract class AbstractGlslProgramAttribute<T>
extends AbstractGlslProgramStorageBuffer<T>
implements GpuShaderProgram.Attribute<T>
    Base implementation of the attribute interface.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from interface: GpuShaderProgram.Attribute
        Gets the name used to identify this instance. In this case, it's the name of the attribute, as specified in the shader's source code.
        Specified by:

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractGlslProgramStorageBuffer<T>
